controllers

Class EvaluateDiagnoseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.EvaluateDiagnoseController

  • @PUBLICAPI
public class EvaluateDiagnoseController
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this controller to give a second opinion on a diagnose of a patient.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EvaluateDiagnoseController(LoginController lc)
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approveDiagnose(DiagnoseIN selected)
      Approves the selected diagnose.
      DiagnoseIN disapproveDiagnose(DiagnoseIN selected, java.lang.String newDiag)
      Disapproves the selected diagnose and replaces it with a new one.
      java.util.Collection<DiagnoseIN> getPendingDiagnosis()
      Use to display pending diagnosis for the doctor who currently is logged on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EvaluateDiagnoseController

        @PUBLICAPI
public EvaluateDiagnoseController(LoginController lc)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        lc - The login controller of the user that wants to evaluate diagnosis with this new controller.
        cpfc - The consult patient file controller that contains the patient file of the patient of whom you want to evaluate diagnosis from.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidLoginControllerException - If the user that is trying to execute method calls on this controller is not a doctor or if the given login controller is invalid in any other way.
        exceptions.DischargePatientException - If the patient that's in the consult patient file controller is currently discharged.
        exceptions.InvalidHospitalException
        exceptions.InvalidConsultPatientFileController
        See Also:
        HospitalController, NeedsLoginAndPatientFileController

    • Method Detail

      • approveDiagnose

        @PUBLICAPI
public void approveDiagnose(DiagnoseIN selected)
        Approves the selected diagnose.
        Throws:
        exceptions.ApproveDiagnoseException - If the selected diagnose does not require a second opinion or the user that's calling this method is not the given doctor of whom the attending doctor required a second opinion.

      • disapproveDiagnose

        @PUBLICAPI
public DiagnoseIN disapproveDiagnose(DiagnoseIN selected,
                                      java.lang.String newDiag)
        Disapproves the selected diagnose and replaces it with a new one.
        Parameters:
        selected - The selected diagnose.
        newDiag - The replacement for the selected diagnose.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        exceptions.ApproveDiagnoseException - If the disapprove of the selected diagnose failed due to authorization reasons, or invalid parameters.

      • getPendingDiagnosis

        @PUBLICAPI
public java.util.Collection<DiagnoseIN> getPendingDiagnosis()
        Use to display pending diagnosis for the doctor who currently is logged on.
